publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 16:02:59 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.abstract: Walter Hooke was vice president and national personnel manager of the United Parcel Service from 1965-1978 and held a variety of labor relations positions. He taught courses in human relations and labor relations later in his life. Hooke was politically active on a number of issues which are reflected in the many letters to Congress and letters to the editor included in this collection. Other documents include newspaper clippings re: Cesar Chavez's death, a transcript of an oral history interview conducted in 1986, and correspondence to Debra Bernhardt.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The provenance of this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Walter Hooke was vice president and national personnel manager of the United Parcel Service from 1965-1978 and held a variety of labor relations positions. He taught courses in human relations and labor relations later in his life. Hooke was politically active on a number of issues which are reflected in the many letters to Congress and letters to the editor included in this collection. Other documents include newspaper clippings re: Cesar Chavez's death, a transcript of an oral history interview conducted in 1986, and correspondence to Debra Bernhardt.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Walter Hooke Papers; WAG 260; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1961-2000, are expected to enter the public domain in 2121.
